messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
I can try to help you figure that out, but I need your current latitude and longitude coordinates to look up your address. Could you please share your current latitude and longitude values?
I don't have that info right now.

That's okay! Since you don't have your exact coordinates, I can't use the address lookup tool right now. 

To find out where you are, here are some quick ways to get your coordinates:

- **On a smartphone**: Open Google Maps → tap the blue dot (your location) → scroll down to see your latitude and longitude.

- **On a computer/Desktop**: Visit [where-am-i.co](https://where-am-i.co) which shows your approximate location.

- **Or**—what device/operating system are you using right now? I can give you tailored steps.
Got it. I'm using my phone.

Since you're on your phone, the quickest way is Google Maps:

1. Open the **Google Maps** app  
2. Tap the **blue dot** (your location icon) on the map  
3. On the info panel that pops up, scroll down — you’ll see **Latitude** and **Longitude** listed (it looks like `12.345678,-98.765432`)  

Just jot those two numbers down and let me know what they are, and I’ll tell you the exact address.
I can't access Google Maps right now.

No problem—Google Maps isn’t the only way. Try one of these alternatives on your phone:

1. Google Search (in any mobile browser)  
   • Go to google.com and type “where am I” or “my location coordinates”  
   • Google will ask for permission to use your location; allow it, and it should display the latitude and longitude.

2. Built-in “Share Location” (many phones)  
   • iPhone: Open the Find My app → People tab → Share My Location → Add yourself temporarily → it shows coordinates.  
   • Android: Settings → Location → Share location → see the coordinates or share to a message/email and read them back.

3. Quick third-party site  
   • Visit https://where-am-i.co or https://www.latlong.net in any browser on your phone; when prompted, allow location access, and the site will list your coordinates.

Use whichever is easiest and let me know the latitude and longitude once you have them!
Alright, I'll give those a try!
Sounds good! Whenever you’ve got those latitude and longitude numbers, just drop them here and I’ll look up your exact address.
